reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel in September 19th - 22nd, 2008.
reviews.title: Beautiful and charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel had some problems with our reservations. I was traveling with my parents (same last name) and we booked 2 different rooms, separately. When we arrived at the hotel they only had one room available under our last name. They confused our reservations, thinking that we were the same person, an honest mistake. Thankfully we both had email confirmations of our reservations and within a couple hours (and a yummy breakfast that they gave us), they came up with another room (as the hotel was full). This room, we believe, is not normally a room they rent out. It was in the back lower portion of the hotel and was basically a small apartment, with a kitchen and living room. My parents stayed in that room, so I can not speak on their behalf.
reviews.title: Wonderful place

reviews.text: The room I stayed in was in the main building where the lobby and breakfast room is located. I can not remember the room number, but it was on the 4th floor, I want to say 416. The room was well appointed and very clean. A comfy queen sized bed with a beautiful bedspread. The walls were covered with cherub wallpaper. Each side of the bed has a nightstand with lights and a telephone. There was also a table with 2 chairs by the window, which had a great view of the buildings in the area. The closet was big enough for my large suitcase and all my clothes with room to spare. The bathroom was a really nice size with a big tub and shower. There is a hairdryer in the bathroom, but as I soon found out is not very strong and I have long thick hair, so it took about an hour to completely dry my hair. There was no clock in the room, so I recommend bringing a small travel clock. The front desk can arrange for a wake up call – which I recommend because it plays cute music including Happy Birthday :) There is a small elevator, which just fit myself and one suitcase – I am not a large person! I used the stairs most of the time.
reviews.title: First time to Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like I said when we first arrived and there was the confusion with our rooms they gave us a complimentary breakfast, otherwise we had breakfast one other time when we were in a rush one morning and didn’t have time to walk around and find a café. The coffee was strong but good and served with warm milk (a nice touch). The breakfast is not the typical American eggs, bacon and pancakes. It is a piece of French bread, a croissant with jelly and butter. I definitely recommend going to one of the many bakeries in the area and getting a ‘Pain au chocolat’ which is a croissant with chocolate in it… very yummy! Eating breakfast inside is nice, but if the weather allows, take advantage of the tables in the courtyard.
reviews.title: very good

likes.disliked: — something on the room activated my alergic problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nice feature is that with your room key is a key swipe device that allows you inside at night, as they lock the big green doors after a certain time (I think it was around 10pm). I felt very secure knowing that no one besides people staying there was allowed inside at night.
reviews.title: enjoyed the area

likes.liked: — good sized room and dinky but very adequate bathroom
likes.disliked: — groundfloor near the entrance, but not enough to ask for a change of room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good value. Small but clean rooms. Friendly staff. Quiet garden for relaxation. Ask for room in back as street can get noisy. Walk to many nice cafes.
reviews.title: Garden Surprise

reviews.text: After reading several magazines and newspaper articles on small boutique hotels in Paris, I picked this hotel for our last two nights. We needed two beds, and was told they would accommmodate us, albeit we must change rooms.
reviews.title: Charm, location, and a warm staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Juliette was wonderful upon our check-in - very helpful and friendly and she speaks great English! She was truly helpful to us! She even gave us specific instructions on how to get to a great restaurant in the 7th using the metro. Salome was wonderful too.
reviews.title: Loved it!

likes.disliked: — It's at the top of a hill--wearying at the end of a long day touring

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms have typical French Provincial wallpaper. The first room at $138 E. was spacious and had a comfortable bed. We had to make up the second bed sitting outside our door, though. The second room, at $118 E was much smaller and the bed was not as comfortable. Both were facing the courtyard and were fairly quiet except for the sound of suitcases rolling down the cobblestones. Bathrooms are newly renovated and nice, but with very narrow and short bathtubs. The room in the main building was served by an elevator, but pulling a suitcase up 33 stairs in the front building was not fun!
reviews.title: Charming, fun, value!

likes.disliked: — Had to use a different room the first night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not take their breakfast (8 E.) as there were several nice bakeries nearby. Also nearby were two metro stops, so you can get anyplace easily!
reviews.title: Like staying with your favourite aunt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wide range of reviews of this hotel is proof positive of "Diff'rent strokes for diffr'ent folks". It's true that the rooms are small. It's true that the in-room amenities (shampoo, lotion, etc.) are minimal. It's true that the breakfast is a French breakfast (bread, coffee, juice), not an American one, and it's expensive for what you get. But.... how many Paris hotels can you stay in where you can leave your window open at night and wake up to birds chirping in the morning? How many hotels have a beautiful, secluded-from-the-street garden and patio where you can retreat when you've had one too many metro ride, been to one too many museums and been jostled on one too many streets? The location is great. You are a 10-minute walk from the heart of the Latin Quarter and the metro is 50 meters away from the front door. My only complaint about this hotel is that they do not have window air conditioners for those July/August nights when it is truly stifling in Paris.
reviews.title: It works for me... excellently!

reviews.text: I stayed here for 4 nights in Aprol 2009 with my daughter. I'd seen it on previous trips and liked the look of it but hadn't been able to book a room. This time I got lucky! It's so handily placed and close to everything (Pantheon, Luxembourg gardens, the river - plus all the cafes and bars you could want) and the garden area is a delight. We were lucky with the weather and so could take advantage of this. So many people came up into the courtyard just to have a look at it and take photos. I've been to paris three times in the last couple of years and I really wouldn't want to stay anywhere else now I've been here. Our room wasn't massive but it had everything we needed and it was spotlessly clean. The staff were lovely and friendly (and just a bit mad which is always good). Didn't have breakfast as my daughter is a teenager and so doesn't do getting up early - but there are plenty of great places nearby to get a pastry and a coffee. You have to book early to stay here - and if you do I don't think you'll be disappointed. I'm going again.
reviews.title: Stay here!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 8 nights here, and in all of our walks around Paris, we never saw another hotel in which we'd rather have stayed. A great bargain for the price. Everyone is friendly and polite. We never heard any street traffic. There's an extra shot of charm with the courtyard. The WiFi connection worked perfectly. And the little neighborhood a block away, around the Place Contrescarpe, was an excellent place to begin the day at the patisserie, or end the day at any of the cafes, or reload on in-room supplies like excellent inexpensive wine at the supermarche. The Metro stop is not far at all, so access to all of Paris was easy. And even on our long walks, we were very quickly at a lot of great Paris locations, having walked by the Cathedral du Notre Dame several times. Saturday nights buzzes with young people. Very fun.
reviews.title: Highly Recommend
Shh ... keep it a secret
reviews.text: Such a charming, romantic hotel. I have stayed there four times, and every time it's like walking into a world of its own, secluded from the noise and the busy trafic. The rooms are rather small, but who wants to spend their time there anyway. And the room rate is a pleasent surprice. Wonderful breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely place to stay for a romantic birthday break. No TV, no minibar, no Sky magazines, no lounge/bar with CNN news pumping round-the-clock from a blurry plasma - bliss! Just the birds singing and the occasional rumble of a suitcase down the garden path outside. Could this really be the centre of Paris? For those who can't go without gazing at a screen for 2 whole days, there was wi-fi - but who needs that when you have all the sights, sounds and smells of one of the world's most atmospheric and exciting cities all around you?
reviews.title: Romantic retreat

reviews.text: After scouring the internet for months before choosing this hotel , I was delighted when I finally arrived. Our room was on the first floor facing the courtyard and larger than I had expected . Rooms were very quaint and the bathroom was spotless. Each morning I was woken up by the birds singing on the tree next to our bedroom window. It was so quiet that we found it hard to believe that we were in the centre of Paris. Just up the street to the left is the rue de Mouffetard ,where there is scores of restaurants and bars at more reasonable prices than other areas, We organised our transfers from and to the airport through Easyjet. It was 30 euros each person return by mini-bus. Our transfer was waiting for us when we arrived at CDG and five minutes early for our return for a fast and efficient service. We thought it was well worth spending a few extra euros for avoiding the hassle of trains and metros,and also saved us precious time.
reviews.title: A charming base for a weekend stay in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel in the Latin Quarter a stone's throw from Rue Muffletard.
reviews.title: Charming

reviews.text: Entering the hotel grounds you pass through an entry gate into cobblestoned walkway to the office. Our room (#33) was on the ground level opening up to the garden--even in early March quite lovely. The room was charming but also clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Perfect for family

reviews.text: No restaurant but you can have a continental breakfast there (9 Euros) if you wish.
reviews.title: Wonderful location, wonderful staff, wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The area nearby, as is most of the Latin Quarter, quite touristy. But the location was close to many places of interest--long walking distance to the Louvre.
reviews.title: Beware of the Hotel Grandes Ecoles

likes.disliked: — Everything. Thi s is a bare-bones accomodation charging high rates.
